item.title: A philosophical sketch
item.description:
Source: here.

mantra motivation

A philosophical sketch of polytheistic pantheism

In the course of our daily study (pārāyaṇa) of the śruti, we practiced the following ṛk of Vasukarṇa, the son of Vasukra of the clan of the Vasiṣṭha-s:

dyāvā-pṛthivī janayann abhi vrata
āpa oṣadhīr vanināni yajñiyā ।
antarikṣaṃ svar ā paprur ūtaye
vaśaṃ devāsas tanvī ni māmṛjuḥ ॥

They generated forth Heaven and Earth for their laws,
the waters, herbs, and the trees belonging to the sacrifice;
They filled the atmosphere and the sky for [our] aid.
The gods clasped their power to themselves.

item.title: Universe simulation
item.description:
Source: TW

Interlocutor: “So, what is your current view of the universe as a simulation?”

I: “I was not initially sympathetic to it. Why add an additional layer of complexity that is not per se giving you any major gain in terms of explanative power. But over the past decade, I have not found anything in my limited understanding and practice of science that falsifies it. Hence, I have come to view it as possible though not certain.”
